content:
Do you mean Status Bar (not popup window)? If the answer is yes, the following methods might be helpful:

Method 1: Click hamburger button (three horizontal bar icon) > "View" > "Toolbars" > tick "Status Bar".

Method 2: (In menu bar) "View" > "Toolbars" > tick "Status Bar".

content: Sue, If I may make a suggestion: don't subscribe to Allmail; that causes users problems here on the forum routinely. Allmail is a duplicate of inbox, sent, etc, and its use doubles the disk space you use while not providing more messages, and it doubles the computer resources and network access time when retrieving and sending messages.
creator: davidsk

content:
Microsoft made some changes so check out the following.

Micosoft now say all email addresses using Microsoft account are now called 'alias' accounts. They must be set up to use the same password as the Microsoft account. Those accounts may have a msn.com, hotmail.com, live.com, outlook.com or other email address using the office365 server.

Whatever account you set up as the 'primary' will be the only email address you can use for smtp outgoing mail no matter what other 'alias' account is receiving mail. But you can choose what you want to set up as 'primary'.

All of the above must be set in the Microsoft account webmail account accessed via a browser.


VPN Check computer to see if there is a VPN that's been enabled. Many Anti-Virus products now offer a VPN but servers do not like VPN as it hides IP so server will block access. Switch VPN off or create a slpit tunnelling and set up Thunderbird to use it.

Localhost If you use a product that uses the 'localhost' then you need to switch it off until Oauth has been set up. Some people manage websites and they might use eg: Apache Xampp and it uses Localhost.


In Thunderbird make sure cookies are allowed.

  • Menu icon > Settings >Privacy & Security
  • Web content
  • Select: Accept cookies from sites and 'always' and 'until they expire'

IMAP settings

  • Server name: outlook.office365.com
  • Port: 993
  • Connection Security: SSL/TLS
  • User Name: full email address
  • Authentication Method: OAuth2

Office 365 SMTP settings

  • Description: full email address
  • Server name: smtp.office365.com
  • Port: 587
  • Connection Security: STARTTLS
  • User Name: full email address of whatever you set up as the 'primary' account
  • Authentication Method: OAuth2


Other info that may be relevant: https://support.mozilla.org/bm/questions/1489736
creator: Toad-Hall

content: I fixed!, If u have the local folders in server (\\server), change to a mapped unit server (u:) in local folders configuration directory

content:
I've uninstalled previous version and reinstalled new version of Thunderbird. I deleted all profiles.

I can install some Gmail accounts but not others. Specifically I try to add one and it says error right off the bat. I don't even get the opportunity to add Oauth. It's just not there. It has IMAP enabled.

I recently changed my password for this Gmail account. Yet the new password doesn't work in Thunderbird. The old one does but it only has old emails! This is strange to me. How can I just get Thunderbird to sync with the new password for the Gmail account?
creator: dan307

content: Please post a screenshot of thunderbird at the point where the error appears. That may help. Also, check that you have set thunderbird to accept cookies at settings>privacy&security. If you changed the password for an account already defined to Thunderbird, it may help to remove the existing passwords first at settings?privacy and security: - click savedpasswords and then showpasswords and then highlight both rows and delete them, - OR, just delete the account and add it back. What you're experiencing is that thunderbird is sending the old app password and it's being rejected.
creator: davidsk

content:
Try this:: - change to table view if not already there. This is the view that shows columns, such as subject, from, date - click the icon on right of the top line in message list pane to add 'tags' column in the display - tag the desired message - click view>sort by and set to tags - now, click the tags column entry on bar at top of message list pane and the tagged item will appear at top.

My suggestion was to use tags, but you can view the menu at view>sort by and you may prefer another option, such as star or priority.
creator: davidsk

Potrebbe trattarsi del problema discusso qui: https://forum.mozillaitalia.org/index.php?topic=79602.0 Però non so se sia il tuo caso, Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)

content: By the way, both the stable and beta releases have the same problem. That is unrelated.

First, reinstalling thunderbird accomplishes nothing, as thunderbird is not the issue. Try this: - click account settings>synchronizaion&storage for each account and set sync to just recent 30 days. - next, exit thunderbird - in profile, in the imap\<accountname> folder for each account, DELETE the message folders and their msf entries. - restart thunderbird, which will repopulate the folders with the new sync setting - then, periodically compact the folders. That is what is causing space on PC to be bigger than space on server.

The phone is a separate entity and has the same issues, but is not a cause of the space usage.
creator: davidsk

content:
Bonjour,

d'après ta copie d'écran tu utilises la vue menu Affichage > Trier par > Discussions groupées comme c'est la norme dans les nouvelles version de TB. Cela signifie que si les discussions groupées sont "réduites" dans une seule ligne tu ne vois pas les messages individuels. Seule une discussion "développée" affiche tous les messages individuels qui en font partie dans la liste des messages.

Tu peux contourner ce problème d'un non-affichage de messages d'une discussion en passant à l'Affichage > Trier par > Discussions non groupées On peux aussi développer une discussion individuelle en cliquant sur la petite flèche > à gauche du sujet (voir mon image)

content:
re : I have had to re-set an email account as the servers updated

What server are you talking about ?

Post an image showing your SMTP outgoing server settings for the account.

First see if this is being blocked by Firewall. Exit Thunderbird Access Firewall, which might be default used by OS or controlled by an Anti-Virus you installed. You need to make sure that Thunderbird program is set up as an allowed program. Then restart Thunderbird.

Please confirm - let me know that Thunderbird is set up as an allowed program.

What Anti-Virus product are you using ?

Exit all programs. You will need to use an ethernet cable to connect computer to router/hub as this does not work if using wireless. Restart your computer using 'Safe Mode with Networking' Start Thunderbird

Please report back on whether you tested in 'Safe mode with Networking' and whether this got access.

Or uninstall AV and then retest.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Put this here for others: You CAN follow the other directions if the account IS NOT YET and IMAP account.

Generally speaking TB seems to add (IMAP) a the end of an IMAP account. Somehow the account in question wasn't so marked, so TB didn't allow me to add another IMAP account.

I just tested this on an existing POP account and the various descriptions elsewhere, do work.
creator: grantwholmes

content: If this is an IMAP account, your efforts may prove fruitless, as IMAP is designed to be a living, continuous, account. You can uncheck 'check for new messages at startup', but that may not do it.

content: if you still have the thunderbird that the IT person set up, you can try this: - click settings>privacy&security - then click savedpasswords and then showpasswords - from there, you can copy the password. You may be prompted for your Windows signin password prior to thunderbird showing the passwords. AND, that saved password won't work on the new device if your email provider requires special 'app' password on each separate device (Gmail is an example of this).
